Jan Algermissen wrote:
>
> The content type header should express the complete payload semantics,  
> otherwise understanding the payload is dependent on out of band  
> information which creates unnecessary coupling and limits the  
> visibility (e.g. for intermediaries).
>   

If you are contrasting a *custom* content-type parameter with a custom 
version header, I don't agree there is more coupling or less visibility 
with the latter.

In fact, intermediary mechanisms would seem better off if the version is 
a separate header in its own right; e.g. the vary mechanism 
(http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.44)

- Mike
